formalText: She doesn't know what she's going to do.
She feels like when she wants to hurt herself, the knowledge that this is not going to go away necessarily isn't enough to keep her from doing it, but she has scars all over her.
She thinks that some things in life are never going to go away.

It's just going to be what she looks like, then she feels like she should either find some way to get comfortable with them or find some way to talk about them about how she's got two, although it's never going to go away.
She just finds it embarrassing because she self-injures and she's kind of embarrassed about it. She can't sort of pretend she hasn't done it because it's right there in front of her all the time.
She just worries that people will always see it as unstable in the way it has been.
Yesterday went a little better eventually.
She doesn't feel like cutting herself is to exert some control over the situation, and she feels like this conversation is out of her control.
So she must be doing something right.
She never really felt comfortable with any of the people that she remembers; it was weird.
